title: 109_hr3558
content: The Act may be cited as the "Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Amendments Act of 2005". Congress finds that the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project, a major component of the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin program, flooded the Cheyenne River Sioux Reservation, causing significant economic and cultural damage to the tribe. Compensation has been provided to affected Indian tribes, including the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe. Congress provided compensation to the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe for the damage caused by the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund was created for this purpose, but did not include compensation for tribal members who lost land. This Act aims to use the Trust Fund to compensate those members and capitalize the fund. The Act aims to use the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund to compensate tribal members who lost land due to the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project and to capitalize the fund. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe will receive equitable compensation under Section 3 of the Act. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act is amended to ensure fair compensation for land acquired for the Oahe Dam and Reservation project. The Act also includes definitions that have been reorganized for clarity. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act is amended to define "member landowner" and "power program" while also making changes to the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act is amended to include the power program under the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin program. The Secretary of the Treasury will deposit 25 percent of the power program funds into the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund annually. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act is amended to include the power program under the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin program. The total amount deposited into the Treasury from the power program equals $290,722,958 plus interest accrued according to specified calculations. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act is amended to include the power program under the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin program. Interest and earnings determined by the Lehman Government Bond Index will be applied for compensation. Changes include the start date for fiscal year adjustments and additional compensation for member landowners in the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act is amended to provide additional compensation to member landowners for land acquisition in the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project. The Secretary of the Interior will assist the Tribe in processing claims of heirs of member landowners. The Tribe is now eligible for certain programs and services under the Act.
